* Fork this repo to your GitHub account and clone the fork to your computer
1. Open IntelliJ (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project dialog first).
1. Set up the correct JDK version.
* Click `Configure` > `Structure for new Projects` (in older versions of Intellij:`Configure` > `Project Defaults` > `Project Structure`).
* If JDK 11 is listed in the drop down, select it. If it is not, click `New...` and select the directory where you installed JDK 11.
1. Locate the project directory and click `OK`.
1. Select `Create project from existing sources` and click `Next`.
1. Rename the project if you want. Click `Next`.
1. Ensure that your src folder is checked. Keep clicking `Next`.
### If you are not using Gradle
1. Import the `libs` folder from the SDK into your project (note: `JAVAFX_HOME` is the directory in which you have unzipped the JavaFX SDK).
1. From `Run` > `Edit Configurations`, add the following line into your `VM options` for each of the `main` classes.
Update your `build.gradle` to include the following lines:
1. Ensure that During Installation, use default location of installation.
2. Right Click Resource folder for JavaFxml Docs to be Resource Root Folder.
**Duke** is a personal assistant chatbot for managing tasks, optimised for use via Command Line Interface (CLI), with a Graphical User Interface (GUI) output.
The app is optimized, i.e. shortcut keys are provided, to support efficient typing experience of end-users.
Duke allows the users to: list find add mark unmark and delete tasks.
Duke is now available in version 1.0. And you can download it from [here](https://github.com/badassengineer/ip/releases).
1. Run the command, `java -jar ip.jar`, in the same folder as the jar file.

2. Specify a filename to begin. That is, `set <filename>` or `s/ <filename>`. If the file exists at *C:\Users\computer name\Duke\filename.txt*, it will be used as the working file. Otherwise, a new file will be automatically created in the same directory.
3. You can exit the application by typing `bye` and hitting the `enter` key.
Below are the commands to adding `todo`, `deadline` or `event` tasks. These tasks will also be added to the working file.
To list task, type `list` and hit the `enter` key.
To mark task, type `mark <specify the task number>` and hit the `enter` key.
To unmark task, type `unmark <specify the task number>` and hit the `enter` key.
To delete task, type `delete <specify the task number>` and hit the `enter` key.
To find task, type `find <specify the keyword>` and hit the `enter` key.
| Run the app       | `java -jar ip.jar` or simply double click the app icon. | -                    |
